did.unittitle: James Branch Cabell, Richmond, to John Cook Wyllie, University of Virginia, Charlottesville

scopecontent.p: [Concerning muddled page proofs for the Biography of the Life of Manuel. ]

did.unittitle: James Branch Cabell to John Cook Wyllie

scopecontent.p: [Inquires about the bibliography; mentions Desmond Tarrant]

did.unittitle: James Branch Cabell, Poynton Lodge, Ophelia, Virginia, to John Cook Wyllie

scopecontent.p: [Discusses several donations to be made by himself and his brother to the University; hopes to see the two volumes of the bibliography before they are printed.]

did.unittitle: James Branch Cabell, Poynton Lodge, Ophelia, Virginia, to John Cook Wyllie

scopecontent.p: [Mentions the printing of Matthew Bruccoli's book and the arrangement for his brother's donations to the University.]

did.unittitle: James Branch Cabell to John Cook Wyllie

scopecontent.p: [Concerning the proposed plan for evaluating his lot of typescripts, manuscripts, and the Kalki volumes; mentions Clifton Waller Barrett. ]

did.unittitle: James Branch Cabell to John Cook Wyllie

scopecontent.p: [Plans to purchase the books of Matthew Bruccoliand Mrs. Brewer.]

did.unittitle: James Branch Cabell to John Cook Wyllie

scopecontent.p: [Writes that the two handsome books have arrived; feels that they are "distinctly epitaphic."]
